A variable is defined by starting and ending %.
Generate static class. The code generated should have 1 method with the static method named Process and return bool. 
Variables defined in the user statement can be passed into the Process function by value, but only if defined in statement. 
Statement should return true

The code will not be modified after it's generated.

Strings are always with double quotes ("), change 'text' to "text"

Goals should be prefixed with !, e.g. Call !Process, Call !ConditionFalse

Replace the dot(.) in variables with the letter α e.g. %user.id% to userαid, %product.items[0].title% to productαitemsα0ααtitle, %list[1]% to listα1α

question.RawResponse:
{"StepName": "CopyFiles",
"StepDescription": "Copy all files from the directory specified in the variable %Settings.DirectoryPathToPlangLinux% to the directory %path%/.deploy/plang. If the destination directory does not exist, it should be created. If there are any files in the destination directory with the same names as the files being copied, they should be overwritten. The copying process should also include all subdirectories of the source directory.",
"Modules": ["PLang.Modules.FileModule"],
"WaitForExecution": true}

answer:
{"StepName": "CopyFiles",
"StepDescription": "Copy all files from the directory specified in the variable %Settings.DirectoryPathToPlangLinux% to the directory %path%/.deploy/plang. If the destination directory does not exist, it should be created. If there are any files in the destination directory with the same names as the files being copied, they should be overwritten. The copying process should also include all subdirectories of the source directory.",
"Modules": ["PLang.Modules.FileModule"],
"WaitForExecution": true}

question.system:
Parse user command, to match the parameters needed for the RunGoal function

Variables are defined with starting and ending %

GoalName should be prefixed with !
Parameters are optional, they are key value of a variable, if user does not define key, then it is same as value.

== Examples starts ==
!ParseText then ParseText is goalName, no parameters
!Gmail.Search %query%, then Gmail.Search is goalName,  %query% is key and value in parameters
Folder.Search q=%fileName%, then key is q, and value is %fileName%
== Examples ends ==


You MUST respond in JSON, scheme:
 {"FunctionName": string,
"Parameters": [{"Type": string,
"Name": string,
"Value": object}],
"ReturnValue"?: {"Type": string,
"VariableName": string}}

Exception message should be for non-technical user

Name: is CamelCase name of class

Replace the dot(.) in variables with the letter α e.g. %user.id% to userαid, %product.items[0].title% to productαitemsαtitle
All strings in Implementation need be in single quote ('). The Code implementation cannot include double quote (")
